file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 30-42-02-04 - WINDSHIELD CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WINDSHIELD CONTACTOR - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the windshield contactors. B. These procedures are applicable to the windshield contactor 1 and windshield contactor 2. C. The windshield contactor 1 is installed in the LH Electrical-power control/distribution box and the windshield contactor 2 is installed in the RH Electrical-power control/distribution box. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 30-42-02-000-801-A WINDSHIELD CONTACTOR - REMOVAL WINDSHIELD CONTACTOR - INSTALLA- ALL 30-42-02-400-801-A TION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 30-42-02 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-42-02-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. WINDSHIELD CONTACTOR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the windshield contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223UZ LH cockpit/pax partition 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH cockpit/pax partition I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the GPU pushbutton, on the overhead panel, is set to OFF. (2) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag, on GPU pushbutton. (3) Make sure that the BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches, on the overhead panel, are set to OFF. (4) Put a DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag, on BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (5) Set the BACKUP pushbutton, on the overhead panel, to OFF. (6) Put a DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag, on BACKUP pushbutton. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-42-02 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) To get access to the windshield contactor 1 (LH electrical-power control/distribution box), remove the lifevest shroud assembly and remove the 223UZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100). (8) To get access to the windshield contactor 2 (RH electrical-power control/distribution box), remove the 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100), through the wardrobe. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Disconnect the electrical connector (9). (2) Remove the nut (7), washers (8) and (5), and bolt (6). (3) Remove the fuse (4). (4) Disconnect the electrical wire (11). For this, remove the nut (10) and washer (12). (5) Remove the four screws (3) and washers (2). (6) Remove the windshield contactor (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-42-02 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Windshield Contactor - Removal/Installation Figure 401 A ZONE B C 224 223UZ 224NZ A ZONE 223 DET. A D WINDSHIELD 1 CONTACTOR (K0001) D WINDSHIELD 2 CONTACTOR (K0002) RH ELECTRICAL-POWER LH ELECTRICAL-POWER DET. B DET. C 1 10. NUT CONTROL/DISTRIBUTION CONTROL/DISTRIBUTION BOX BOX 11. ELECTRICAL WIRE 12. WASHER 1 TORQUE OF 2.6-2.9 N.m (23-26 lbf.in) 2 TORQUE OF 6.8-7.9 N.m (60-70 lbf.in) 1. WINDSHIELD CONTACTOR (K0001 OR K0002) 9. ELECTRICAL CONNECTOR 2. WASHER (4) 8. WASHER 3. SCREW (4) 4. FUSE 1 7. NUT 5. WASHER 2 145AMM300013.MCE B 6. BOLT EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 30-42-02 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 30-42-02-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. WINDSHIELD CONTACTOR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the windshield contactor. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-03/100 - COMPONENT LOCATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 AMM TASK 30-42-00-700-801-A/500 WINDSHIELD HEATING - OPERATIONAL CHECK C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 223UZ LH cockpit/pax partition 224 224NZ RH cockpit/pax partition D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To apply the torque available E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task LH or RH cockpit/pax partition I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the windshield contactor (1) in the electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1). (2) Install the screws (3) and washers (2) to attach the windshield contactor (1) in the electrical-power control/distribution box. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 30-42-02 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Connect the electrical wire (11) with the washer (10) and nut (9). (4) Apply a torque to the nut (9), as necessary. (5) Put the fuse (4) on the windshield contactor (1). (6) Install the washer (8) and the nut (7). (7) Apply a torque to the nut (7), as necessary. (8) Install the washer (5) and bolt (6). (9) Apply a torque to the bolt (6), as necessary. (10) Connect the electrical connector (9). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Close the 223UZ or 224NZ access panel ( AMM MPP 06-41-03/100), and install the lifevest shroud assembly (as applicable). (2) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-AUTO tag from the BACKUP pushbutton. (3) Set the BACKUP pushbutton to AUTO. (4) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ON tag from the GPU pushbutton. (5) Remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-AUTO tag from BATT 1 and BATT 2 switches. (6) Do the Operational Check of the Windshield Heating System ( AMM TASK 30-42-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 30-42-02 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
